text:
Hey guys, is there any way to *disable editing global partial*?

I’m building a global header for a client that has multiple websites on the same domain. I want to have a single module with a couple of pickers where end user picks only company, and the header is adjusted (logo, menu, CTA, etc.).

My issue is that I created a global partial but it can be edited by end user on the global level and when I choose an image in the module, it seems to be overwritten by globally selected image. I can’t manage to avoid that so I though of maybe disabling editing global partial.

Hey there, we actually have a dedicated permission specifically for global content.

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/settings/HubSpot-user-permissions-guide#:~:text=Global%20content%20settings%3A>

Would it solve your problem to simply only give that access to folks you trust with that access?

Never mind, used a to json method to resolve the issue. But I did find a way to add single quotes to a string if needed  I ll put below                                    {%set cta1= "\'" + 'stringvalue'|join("\', \'") + "\'"%}
